document_data.name: The Castlegate
document_data.Location: The Castlegate was located in the [[Castle Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]].

Interior.Atmosphere: The atmosphere in the inn was described as impersonal, clean, and formal. It catered mostly to wealthier travelers and middle class Waterdhavian residents.

document_data.Services:
The tenday rate for a shared room included watered down [[wine]], three meals a day, and a cold bath every three nights. Patrons could pay extra for hot water to bathe in.
In addition to rooms for rent, the Castlegate had a large dining room on the first floor, which served hot [[tea]].
